pullRequest.title: Included DeepLabV3 Image Segmentation example & some minor fixes
pullRequest.bodyText:
Description
As for Image Segmentation there was just one example available, the FCN (Fully Convolutional Network), the DeepLabV3 pre-trained model deployment example using TorchServe has been included as it is the current SOTA of image segmentation.
So on, now under examples/image_segmenter there are two directories available for both FCN and DeepLabV3, rather than just the fcn/ one.
Here I will describe all the things that have been fixed, included, taken into consideration, etc. so that you can have a look and LMK if there's anything missing so that I can include it before the PR is being merged (if so):

Updated examples/image_segmenter/README.md just like examples/object_detector/README.md as they both contain examples of models that use the default TorchServe inference handlers, in this case the image_segmenter one.
The DeepLabV3 pre-trained model with a ResNet101 backbone available at https://download.pytorch.org/models/deeplabv3_resnet101_coco-586e9e4e.pth has been included as an example under the examples/image_segmenter/deeplabv3 directory with all the required files to generate the MAR file using torch-model-archiver and serve it using torchserve. Note that all the code used (even though minor tweaks have been done) is part of torchvision image segmentation models available at https://github.com/pytorch/vision/tree/master/torchvision/models/segmentation.
Updated references to examples/image_segmenter/fcn/persons.jpg as the new image is being placed in examples/image_segmenter/persons.jpg, just like on all the other directories with more than one model example.
Removed extra brackets in the sample output provided in examples/image_segmenter/fcn/README.md as the curl output is not like [Batch, Height, Width, 2] but like [Height, Width, 2] as the first batch is already selected by the image_segmenter handler.
Included the new DeepLabV3 MAR file into the models/model_zoo.md file even though it has not been uploaded to https://torchserve.pytorch.org/mar_files yet, but it should. And also included in test/postman/inference_data.json, which again, requires the MAR file to be uploaded in https://torchserve.pytorch.org/mar_files. Regarding this point, I can send you via email or e.g. Dropbox link the MAR file I generated using the torch-model-archiver script in examples/image_segmenter/deeplabv3/README.md
Generated and included the DeepLabV3 Torchscripted model, besides the Eager one, and all the documentation and indexing attached to it just like for the Eager one.
Some minor typos and some lines exceeding the PEP8 line-length standards have been fixed.

Fixes #(issue)
There is no open issue for this, but LMK if you want to me to create an issue so that this PR references and solves it.
Type of change

 New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
 This change requires a documentation update

Feature/Issue validation/testing
I've performed some tests over the performance of the model and making sure that the MAR file was being generated as expected, but I would love some advice on how to document this section if applicable.
Please describe the tests [UT/IT] that you ran to verify your changes and relevant result summary. Provide instructions so it can be reproduced.
Please also list any relevant details for your test configuration.


 Test A


 Test B


UT/IT execution results


Logs


Checklist:

 Have you added tests that prove your fix is effective or that this feature works? -> Just included the MAR generation using torch-model-archiver and the deployment notes using torchserve in examples/image_segmenter/deeplabv3/README.md
 New and existing unit tests pass locally with these changes? -> Local tests on with different deployment configurations have been tested both locally and inside Docker containers as explained in docker/README.md for example.
 Has code been commented, particularly in hard-to-understand areas? -> Code is pretty simple and keeps the same structure as examples/image_segmenter/fcn code, so it has not been commented.
 Have you made corresponding changes to the documentation? -> Yes, the following README's have been updated: examples/image_segmenter/fcn/README.md, examples/image_segmenter/deeplabv3/README.md and examples/image_segmenter/README.md, but nothing else has been done regarding the documentation (LMK what else should I document).

commit.message: fixed minor docker port option error
moved FCN README.md & created new main README
included deeplabv3 sample README & some minor tasks defined
moved persons.jpg image from image_segmenter/fcn/ to image_segmenter/
fixed line lenght to pep8 & removed extra spaces
generated MAR, updated script & included size in mb
included temporary deployment notes for FCN
resnet101 set to True & removed aux_classifier
included deployment notes for deeplabv3 pretrained model
included FCNHead on DeepLabV3 pre-trained model
removed deployment notes & included deeplabv3 output

nodes.bodyText: Update model's name and size as the PyTorch model is not DeepLabV3+ but DeepLabV3 and the size has changed since the latest MAR generation as this size does not correspond to a valid MAR.

nodes.bodyText: Maybe also the DeepLabV3 Resnet 101 Scripted should be included too?
Should we include here the deeplabv3_resnet_101 and deeplabv3_resnet_101_scripted models so that the sanity checks also run over the DeepLabV3 model?

If the previously mentioned models are included, note that all the sanity check fields should be completed with the information related to those models such as the sample inputs and the required handlers.

This may not be required as not all the models are included on the sanity checks, but it should be a nice feature to have, even though the build will fail unless the model MAR is included in the https://torchserve.pytorch.org/mar_files host.
Should we include here the deeplabv3_resnet_101 and deeplabv3_resnet_101_scripted models so that the sanity checks also run over the DeepLabV3 model?

If we include deeplabv3_resnet_101 and deeplabv3_resnet_101_scripted models, we should also include the MODEL_INPUTS and the HANDLERS for those model in the same order that they are included in the listing so as to ensure that the sanity checks run successfully over those models.

commit.message: updated deeplabv3 name, details and MAR url
included missing deeplabv3 MAR urls & added auto-download
revert sanity fixes as adding dropbox url doesn't work
Update and rename torchserve_sanity.sh to torchserve_sanity.py
updated dropbox hosted mar files urls & included tests
uploaded model urls as provided by @lxning
torchscripted tests included back & fixed fcn image path
